snippet: The programs are an effort to tighten American border security, and have required substantial concessions from foreign leaders.
abstract: American officers are now advising the local authorities at foreign airports as part of a program to expedite travel for passengers regarded as low-risk; by placing officers in foreign countries and effectively pushing the United States border thousands of miles beyond the country’s shores, Americans have more control over screening and security.
lead_paragraph: The programs are an effort to tighten American border security, and have required substantial concessions from foreign leaders.

headline.seo: U.S. Adds to Screenings for Departures at Foreign Airports
headline.main: U.S. Security Expands Presence at Foreign Airports
headline.print_headline: Not Waiting for Arrivals, U.S. Adds Screenings for Departures at Foreign Airports
